content: I would like to make an MCP based on https://internals.rust-lang.org/t/x-py-remove-python-2-support/15045 and the feedbacks. Would anyone on the compilers team like to be nominated as the reviewer?
simulacrum would be a good reviewer (but I'm still skeptical this is a necessary change and I'd like to hear some more justification of why it's needed)
This doesn't _really_ fit under T-compiler but bootstrap doesn't have its own team so T-compiler is probably as good a place as any

Joshua Nelson said:

simulacrum would be a good reviewer (but I'm still skeptical this is a necessary change and I'd like to hear some more justification of why it's needed)

I won't mention anything about x.py clean, I agree now that unnecessary recompilations are bugs that need to be solved separately.

But I still think we shouldn't be stuck writing Python 2.7 for whatever changes we make to bootstrap.py though
Just know that hou are not forced to nominate a reviewer for the MCP. You can if you know one, but when you open the MCP, all the compiler team members and contributors will be pinged anyway

Yes, I can likely be the assigned party, but I agree with @Joshua Nelson that I don't think the time has come -- there's no real pain that I am aware of from supporting both, and not doing so doesn't seem to give us any real benefits (since binaries are still named differently etc on different platforms).
